Generation III.Ruby: Flygon is nicknamed “the elemental spirit of the desert.” Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this Pok é mon is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.
Generation III.Sapphire: Flygon whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. The wings create a series of notes that sound like singing. Because the “singing” is the only thing that can be heard in a sandstorm, this Pok é mon is said to be the desert spirit.
Generation III.Emerald: The flapping of its wings sounds like singing. To prevent detection by enemies, it hides itself by flapping up a cloud of desert sand.
Generation III.FireRed: It hides itself by kicking up desert sand with its wings. Red covers shield its eyes from sand.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It hides itself by kicking up desert sand with its wings. Red covers shield its eyes from sand.

Generation IV.Diamond: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as "The Desert Spirit."
Generation IV.Pearl: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as "The Desert Spirit."
Generation IV.Platinum: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as "The Desert Spirit."
Generation IV.HeartGold: It is nicknamed "The Desert Spirit" because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It is nicknamed "The Desert Spirit" because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.

Generation V.Black: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as "The Desert Spirit."
Generation V.White: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as "The Desert Spirit."

Generation V.White 2: Known as "The Desert Spirit," this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.

Generation VI.X: It hides itself by kicking up desert sand with its wings. Red covers shield its eyes from sand.
Generation VI.Y: Known as "The Desert Spirit," this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Flygon is nicknamed "the elemental spirit of the desert." Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this Pokémon is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Flygon whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. The wings create a series of notes that sound like singing. Because the "singing" is the only thing that can be heard in a sandstorm, this Pokémon is said to be the desert spirit.

Generation VII.Sun: The flapping of its wings sounds something like singing. Those lured by the sound are enveloped in a sandstorm, becoming Flygon's prey.
Generation VII.Moon: This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms it creates and seldom appears where people can see it.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: By flapping their wings, Flygon cause sandstorms that conceal Krookodile. The team then splits the prey they catch.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: People continue to have their hearts stolen by its enchanting songs and find themselves stranded in the desert.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms it creates and seldom appears where people can see it.
Generation VIII.Shield: It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as the Desert Spirit.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as the Desert Spirit.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Known as the Desert Spirit, this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.
Generation IX.Violet: The sound of its wings flapping resembles singing. Those entranced by this sound get lured into a sandstorm and become Flygon’s prey.
